title: Saint Croix National Scenic Riverway: Do Business With Us
body: Do Business With Us       Commercial Use Authorization A Commercial Use Authorization (CUA) is a permit that authorizes appropriate commercial services to park area visitors in limited circumstances. The term of a CUA is one year and no preferential right of renewal or similar provisions for renewal may be provided. Commercial Use Authorizations are NOT concessions contracts and are not transferable. CUAs are intended to provide a simple means to authorize appropriate commercial services to visitors in park areas. CUAs at the St. Croix National Scenic Riverway, as a general rule:   Do not use fixed commercial facilities within a national park unit. The commercial activity originates and terminates outside the park area. No money changes hands on park lands. No commercial solicitation occurs on park lands.   If you have questions contact the park program administrator at 715-483-2241, or by email.  Laws, Regulations, and Policies   Commercial Use Authorization (CUA) Interim Guidelines (.pdf)      CUA Applications These forms will help you complete an application for a Commercial Use Authorization.     Form 10-550 Application for Commercial Use Authorization (.pdf) Application Instructions (.pdf)      CUA Application Procedure CUAs are valid for one calendar year, expiring on December 31 of the year an application is submitted and approved. Applications are only accepted between December 1, 2016 and March 30, 2016. Please contact the park program administrator to inquire when applications will next be accepted.   Requests for CUA applications may be made in person at park headquarters, or by email or letter. A completed application and the non-refundable application fee are required before an application can be processed. Park contact information is:     St. Croix National Scenic Riverway 401 North Hamilton St. St. Croix Falls, WI  54024   715-483-2241 FAX: 715-483-3288 www.nps.gov/sacn email    CUA Terms and Conditions The National Park Service has terms and conditions on all commercial service agreements. The standard conditions found in all CUAs are located on pages 2 and 3 of the application instructions. The St. Croix National Scenic Riverway also has park specific operating conditions attached as an Appendix to the CUA. The Appendix is the park specific conditions for the specific activity, i.e.: guided photography.    The authority for the NPS to impose user charges to recover costs associated with managing commercial operations is found in 31 U.S.C. 9701 and 16 U.S.C. 3a. Application fees for CUAs are non-refundable. The application fees is $150.00. Administration and monitoring fees may also apply.   Make a payment   As a condition of the CUA, the permittee is required to submit monthly activity reports and an annual gross receipt report.
